You're not dead; but then again, you can't die. You retire as a player character. [Ongoing]
fallout.critical.blood.ghost.name: Ghost
fallout.critical.blood.ghost.description: You die, but your spirit doesn't rest easy. Your ghost remains in the City Beneath, angry at the manner of its death and the friends who it believes failed it - you haunt the party. Until they lay your spirit to rest (or murder it with specialised weapons), they suffer D6 Mind or Echo stress at the start of every session. [Immediate]
fallout.critical.echo.beast.name: Beast
fallout.critical.echo.beast.description: Your body warps and changes beyond recognition: you become a protean mess of meat and bone, terrifying to behold. You disappear into the Heart, surfacing only as a legend whispered in deep shadows; those who knew you tell stories of your exploits to remember you and warn others. You will be seen again in future sessions: the GM can use the stats for a Greater Heartsblood Beast to represent you. [Immediate]
fallout.critical.echo.burst.name: Burst
fallout.critical.echo.burst.description: Unable to contain the energy (or parasites, or your alternate self) within your form any longer, your body ruptures like overripe fruit. If you're lucky, you die; otherwise, you're kept alive indefinitely, spread throughout the Heart. Anyone standing near you marks D6 stress to Echo.
fallout.critical.echo.descent.name: Descent
fallout.critical.echo.descent.description: The next time you're in a landmark,the ground shakes as the Heart draws you and the place further down. Move the landmark, and anyone in it, to the next available space on the tier below. This is catastrophic; most people will not survive. You are swallowed up by the Heart, and retire as a player character.[Immediate]
fallout.critical.echo.messiah.name: Messiah
fallout.critical.echo.messiah.description: You have been followed by a cult of weirdos and monsters for long enough now - something's got to give. One of two things happen: either you believe your own hype and become a cult leader, leaving your life of delving behind and attempting to set up shop in a new haven within the Heart, or the cult out you as a false prophet and attempt to kill you in an appropriately brutal and public manner. [Immediate]
fallout.critical.echo.petrified.name: Petrified
fallout.critical.echo.petrified.description: Your body calcifies, ossifies or crystalises, and you become a perfect statue of yourself. Your body is incredibly resistant to damage, so most people who turn into statues are left where they stand as a warning to others or as a sombre tribute.
fallout.critical.echo.the_ravening.name: The Ravening
fallout.critical.echo.the_ravening.description: Your body hatches with a wet red noise and a Ravening Beast emerges from you, skinless and steaming with heat, hungry for food. You die; this is how they breed. If your surviving friends are nearby. [Immediate]
fallout.critical.echo.stranded.name: Stranded
fallout.critical.echo.stranded.description: Somewhere along the line, your reality diverged from everyone else's - and by the time you realise, it's too late to do anything about it. You are marooned in a fracture, an alternate future or a parasite dimension - tell the group about where you spend the rest of your life. You might return, but it's doubtful that anyone you know will recognise you (or be alive) by the time you get back. [Immediate]
fallout.critical.mind.abandon.name: Abandon
fallout.critical.mind.abandon.description: You have taken complete leave of your senses after the horrors that the Heart has laid upon you. You wander off into the wilderness; if you return, you will not be recognisable. More likely, you will starve to death in a cellar. [Immediate]
fallout.critical.mind.break.name: Break
fallout.critical.mind.break.description: You completely lose it. Anyone standing nearby who you care about marks D8 stress to Mind; anyone standing nearby who you've never really liked marks D8 stress to Blood as you attack them. After this, you die (either self-inflicted or at the hands of your allies) or your mind is so shattered that you retire as a player character. [Immediate]
fallout.critical.mind.obsessed.name: Obsessed
fallout.critical.mind.obsessed.description: Your purpose has become twisted and cruel; you will stop at nothing to achieve it. Your character is retired from play and becomes an antagonist that acts against the surviving player characters in an effort to achieve their wicked desires.[Immediate,Ongoing]
fallout.critical.fortune.fools_gold.name: Fool's Gold
fallout.critical.fortune.fools_gold.description: You get exactly what you want - secrets, penitence, freedom, whatever. It seems too good to be true, which is apt, because it isn't: you've been tricked or deluded, and you don't have it after all. The stress is too much for you to bear,and your only worth now is as a warning to other delvers not to take things at face value. [Immediate]
fallout.critical.fortune.heavy_hangs_the_head.de: Despite your best efforts, you are elected leader of a haven; maybe you defend it from an attack and the people think you've got what it takes to run the place. You don't. You have the capacity to do one useful thing with the haven's resources before you're assassinated by your rivals, the haven is overrun or the fact you were a patsy all along is revealed and you're hung out to dry. [Immediate]
fallout.critical.fortune.a_slow_and_insidious_ki: You act with unearned confidence and your hubris is rewarded with an ironic death. [Immediate]
fallout.critical.fortune.wrong_place.name: Wrong Place
fallout.critical.fortune.wrong_place.description: You accidentally take a fatal blow meant for someone else. They are unharmed; you die. [Immediate]
fallout.critical.supplies.defenceless.name: Defenceless
fallout.critical.supplies.defenceless.descriptio: Your shield shatters; your sword breaks when struck by an enemy; or your armour straps rip and come apart. Unable to hold your foes off for any longer, you are run through or mauled and left for dead. [Immediate]
fallout.critical.supplies.pitch_black.name: Pitch Black
fallout.critical.supplies.pitch_black.descriptio: Unable to see, you are dragged away by darkling creatures, never to return. [Immediate]
fallout.critical.supplies.plummet.name: Plummet
fallout.critical.supplies.plummet.description: Your line snaps; your hooks don't hold; your pick shears away and tumbles into a chasm. Whatever it is, you plunge into the darkness beneath and do not return.[Immediate]
fallout.critical.supplies.starvation.name: Starvation
fallout.critical.supplies.starvation.description: You starve to death or are overcome by dehydration. [Immediate]

tag.block.name: Block
tag.bloodbound.name: Bloodbound
tag.bloodbound.description: Mark D4 stress to Blood to roll with mastery when using this equipment for the rest of the situation.
tag.brutal.name: Brutal
tag.brutal.description: When you roll for stress against an adversary when using this item, roll two dice and pick the highest. Multiple instances of this tag stack: if you managed to get it three times, you???d roll four dice and pick the highest when calculating stress.
tag.conduit.name: Conduit
tag.conduit.description: Mark D4 stress to Mind to roll with mastery when using this equipment for the rest of the situation.
tag.dangerous.name: Dangerous
tag.dangerous.description: When you inflict stress with this item and roll the maximum amount, mark D6 stress to Blood.
tag.debilitating.name: Debilitating
tag.debilitating.description: Once per situation, when you inflict stress with this item to one or more targets, the next attack made against them is rolled with mastery.
tag.degenerating.name: Degenerating
tag.degenerating.description: If you take damage from a weapon with this tag, roll Endure+[Domain] at the end of the situation.On a failure, mark D6 stress; on a partial success, mark D4 stress; on a success, mark none.
tag.distressing.name: Distressing
tag.distressing.description: When you inflict stress with this item and roll the maximum amount, mark D6 stress to Mind.
tag.double_barreled.name: Double-Barreled
tag.double_barreled.description: As Reload, but you can use the item twice before reloading.
tag.expensive.name: Expensive
tag.expensive.description: When you inflict stress with this item and roll the maximum amount, mark D6 stress to Supplies.
tag.extreme_range.name: Extreme Range
tag.extreme_range.description: This item can be used at extreme range.
tag.limited(X).name: Limited ${X}
tag.limited(X).description: You can use this ${X} times before it gives out.
tag.loud.name: Loud
tag.loud.description: When you inflict stress with this item and roll the maximum amount, mark D6 stress to Fortune.
tag.obscuring.name: Obscuring
tag.obscuring.description: The bearer and any nearby allies reduce the damage of incoming and outgoing ranged weapons by 1 step.
tag.one_shot.name: One-Shot
tag.one_shot.description: This equipment takes a very long time to prepare, so you can only use it once per situation.
tag.piercing.name: Piercing
tag.piercing.description: You cannot reduce stress inflicted by this equipment by using Blood Protection, and adversaries do not benefit from their protection value.
tag.point_blank.name: Point-Blank
tag.point_blank.description: As Ranged, but at very close range it increases its stress dice by one step. If the shot travels far enough to spread out and dissipate, it lowers its stress dice by one step.
tag.potent.name: Potent
tag.potent.description: When you roll for stress removed from yourself or an ally with this item, roll two dice and pick the highest. Multiple instances of this tag stack as per the Brutal tag.
tag.ranged.name: Ranged
tag.ranged.description: This equipment can be used at range.
tag.reload.name: Reload
tag.reload.description: This equipment must be reloaded between uses, giving enemies a chance to close in or flee.
tag.smoke.name: Smoke
tag.smoke.description: As Obscuring, but only when the item is used,and only around the area it was used.
tag.spread.name: Spread
tag.spread.description: Anyone standing near the target on a successful use must roll Evade+Domain (or another applicable skill) to avoid marking stress as well. On a partial success, downgrade the stress dice by one size. NPCs caught in a blast simply take the stress.
tag.tiring.name: Tiring
tag.tiring.description: When you fail an action using this equipment, the size of its stress dice decreases by 1 for the remainder of the situation.
tag.trusty.name: Trusty
tag.trusty.description: When you roll for stress marked against a delve while using this item, roll two dice and pick the highest.Multiple instances of this tag stack as per the Brutal tag.
tag.unreliable.name: Unreliable
tag.unreliable.description: When you fail an action using this equipment, it cannot be used for the remainder of the situation if in a landmark or for the remainder of the journey if on a delve.
tag.wyrd.name: Wyrd
tag.wyrd.description: When you inflict stress with this item and roll the maximum amount, mark D6 stress to Echo

dialog.content(VERSION):
Welcome to Heart v{VERSION}

A Quick Intro

Players: you can make rolls from Chat when requested, or directly from your character sheet. Your GM will provide you with class/callings which you can drag & drop onto your sheet.

GMs: the 'Prepare Rollout Request' macro will help your players make rolls more easily. You'll need to create classes and callings for your players by hand, but it should be more or less intuitive how to do this.

New In This Version

  • Compendia! There are now compendia for Fallouts, Tags, Callings and some of the Classes.

Recently Changed

  • Added a new translation: Espaol! Thanks go to jesberpen for providing the translation!
  • Fixed text-based descriptions on character sheets
  • Fixed code that broke some chat hooks (e.g. Theatre Inserts).
  • Bug fixing missing output from rollable tables
  • New item type: Tag!
  • Resources and Equipment can contain Tags, adjustable in their sheet views. Tags will also show up in the brackets section of their previews.
  • Added a section to show inactive items that the actor directly and made dragged items active by default
  • Fixes to allow dragging items onto classes & callings
  • New Startup Message (you're reading it)
  • Module Setting to hide old text boxes in character sheets
  • Added 'Class' Item type for character sheets
  • Abilities, Beats, Resources and Equipment inherited from classes and callings show up on the character sheet (toggle with ). You can pick new items from the class/calling sheets.

What's In The Works?

  • Nicer Item Sheets
  • Advanced Options for ActiveEffects on Fallout & Abilities, e.g. Abilities directly improving Protections.
